alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Monona; Shelby (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 01 at 4:26AM CST until January 02 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Monona, Harrison and Shelby Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight tonight to 9 AM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills will be dangerous through the period and will dip as low as 25 below zero throughout the day today and into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
